title.narrative: WASH IN INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: Families and people, particularly the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, access to water, sanitation and hygiene services in health care settings, schools, learning spaces, shelters and protection spaces, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children, women, and other people, particularly the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, live in a clean and safe environment and people are empowered to adopt adequate hygiene practices

participating-org.narrative: COMITATO INTERNAZIONALE PER LO SVIL DEI POPOLI

sector.narrative: WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Families and people, particularly the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, access to water, sanitationand hygiene services in health care settings, schools, learning spaces, shelters and protection spaces

description.narrative: This year, UNICEF’s main programmatic focus was ensuring children had the necessary hygiene and safe conditions to return to classes. Therefore, UNICEF has adapted its “WASH in schools” approach, according to recent IPC protocols and “3-star” standards, including its support to ongoing school-feeding programmes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022
